question: Which country houses "Bale Mountain National Park"?
explanation: Bale Mountain National Park is an IUCN Category II National Park located in Ethiopia. This national park covers the Bale Mountains and Sanetti Plateau of the Ethiopian Highlands. This park was included in the UNESCO World Heritage Tentative List. Afromontane habitats form the vegetation and ecosystem of this national park. This national park plays an important role in the regional climate by attracting good amounts of orographic rainfall which is vital for its livestock and agricultural production.
